Doc: A transaction leg for a repo is equivalent to a single cash transaction.

Source.Contents:
/#
   A transaction leg for a repo is equivalent to a single cash transaction.
 #/
record FpML5.confirmation.RepoNearLeg {
  # A reference to the party that buys this instrument, ie. pays for this instrument and receives the rights defined by it. See 2000 ISDA definitions Article 11.1 (b). In the case of FRAs this the fixed rate payer.
  buyerPartyReference : FpML5.confirmation.PartyReference

  # A reference to the account that buys this instrument.
  buyerAccountReference : FpML5.confirmation.AccountReference?

  # A reference to the party that sells ("writes") this instrument, i.e. that grants the rights defined by this instrument and in return receives a payment for it. See 2000 ISDA definitions Article 11.1 (a). In the case of FRAs this is the floating rate payer.
  sellerPartyReference : FpML5.confirmation.PartyReference

  # A reference to the account that sells this instrument.
  sellerAccountReference : FpML5.confirmation.AccountReference?

  # Settlement or Payment Date for the transaction.
  settlementDate : FpML5.confirmation.AdjustableOrRelativeDate

  # Settlement Amount
  settlementAmount : FpML5.confirmation.Money

  # Indicates the rate of a currency conversion that is used to compute settlement amount for cross-currency transactions.
  fxRate : FpML5.confirmation.FxRate?

  # Specifies a delivery method for the security transaction.
  deliveryMethod : string

  # Delivery Date for the transaction. Delivery Date can be populated when it is not equal to the Settlement Date.
  deliveryDate : FpML5.confirmation.AdjustableOrRelativeDate?

  # Collateral element is used to carry the quantity and price details that are required to ensure that a repo contract is executed at fair value, with the value of the collateral matching the cash amount of the repo. Collateral is declared as optional here, with multiple cardinalities, since there can be a repo "Multi", with multiple instruments specified, or a "Cash Borrow/Loan" and “TriPartyRepo” with no collateral. In general cases, however it should be specified. This element can be omitted in farLeg.
  collateral : FpML5.confirmation.CollateralValuation

  id : string?

}

buyerPartyReference.Doc: A reference to the party that buys this instrument, ie. pays for this instrument and receives the rights defined by it. See 2000 ISDA definitions Article 11.1 (b). In the case of FRAs this the fixed rate payer.
buyerPartyReference.Name: buyerPartyReference

buyerAccountReference.Name: buyerAccountReference

sellerPartyReference.Doc: A reference to the party that sells ("writes") this instrument, i.e. that grants the rights defined by this instrument and in return receives a payment for it. See 2000 ISDA definitions Article 11.1 (a). In the case of FRAs this is the floating rate payer.
sellerPartyReference.Name: sellerPartyReference

sellerAccountReference.Doc: A reference to the account that sells this instrument.
sellerAccountReference.Name: sellerAccountReference

settlementDate.Doc: Settlement or Payment Date for the transaction.
settlementDate.Name: settlementDate

fxRate.Doc: Indicates the rate of a currency conversion that is used to compute settlement amount for cross-currency transactions.
fxRate.Name: fxRate

deliveryMethod.Doc: Specifies a delivery method for the security transaction.
deliveryMethod.Name: deliveryMethod

deliveryDate.Doc: Delivery Date for the transaction. Delivery Date can be populated when it is not equal to the Settlement Date.
deliveryDate.Name: deliveryDate

collateral.Doc: Collateral element is used to carry the quantity and price details that are required to ensure that a repo contract is executed at fair value, with the value of the collateral matching the cash amount of the repo. Collateral is declared as optional here, with multiple cardinalities, since there can be a repo "Multi", with multiple instruments specified, or a "Cash Borrow/Loan" and “TriPartyRepo” with no collateral. In general cases, however it should be specified. This element can be omitted in farLeg.
collateral.Name: collateral
